sentence.Network_cn: 正式签订了每年可续签的合同。

sentence.Network_cn: 尽管没有正式的权力，贵族阶层并非没有权势。

sentence.Network_en: They decided to put their relationship on a more formal footing.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin formalis, from forma 'shape, mould' (see form)

entry.def: Formal speech or behaviour is very correct and serious rather than relaxed and friendly, and is used especially in official situations.

example.ex: He wrote a very formal letter of apology to Douglas...
example.tran: 他给道格拉斯写了一封非常正式的道歉信。

example.ex: Business relationships are necessarily a bit more formal.
example.tran: 商业关系有必要更正式一些。

entry.tran: (行为、声明或要求)官方的，正式的
entry.def: A formal action, statement, or request is an official one.

example.ex: UN officials said a formal request was passed to American authorities...
example.tran: 联合国官员称正式请求已向美国当局转达。

example.ex: No formal announcement had been made.

entry.def: Formal occasions are special occasions at which people wear smart clothes and behave according to a set of accepted rules.

example.ex: One evening the film company arranged a formal dinner after the play.
example.tran: 一天晚上，电影公司在演出结束后安排了一个正式的晚宴。

entry.tran: (服饰)正规的，正式的，适合正式场合的
entry.def: Formal clothes are very smart clothes that are suitable for formal occasions.

example.ex: They wore ordinary ties instead of the more formal high collar and cravat.
example.tran: 他们打着普通的领带，而不是更为正式的高领领结。

entry.tran: 整齐的;规矩的;井然有序的
entry.def: Something that is done, written, or studied in a formal way has a very ordered, organized method or style.

example.ex: This does not encourage the child to analyse the environment in a formal way...
example.tran: 这并不能鼓励孩子有条理地分析周围的环境。

example.ex: Classic Greek drama was written in verse, usually in an elevated and formal style.
example.tran: 古典希腊戏剧以韵文写成，通常用词讲究、结构整齐。

entry.def: Formal education or training is given officially, usually in a school, college, or university.

example.ex: Although his formal education stopped after primary school, he was an avid reader...
example.tran: 尽管小学毕业后就再没有受过正规的教育，他却十分爱读书。

example.ex: Leroy didn't have any formal dance training.
example.tran: 勒罗伊没受过任何正规的舞蹈训练。

entry.tran: (尤指按照某种设计规则)布局匀称的，布置整齐的
entry.def: A formal garden or room is arranged in a very regular and controlled way, especially according to certain rules of design.

example.ex: The Coronata wallpaper lends a formal air to the dining room.
example.tran: 科罗娜塔墙纸给餐厅增添了一种整齐有致的气氛。

means.word_mean: 1. being in accord with established forms and conventions and requirements (as e.g. of formal dress);

sentences.sentence: "the requirement was only formal and often ignored"

means.word_mean: 2. characteristic of or befitting a person in authority;
3. (of spoken and written language) adhering to traditional standards of correctness and without casual, contracted, and colloquial forms;

sentences.sentence: "the paper was written in formal English"

means.word_mean: 4. represented in simplified or symbolic form
6. refined or imposing in manner or appearance; befitting a royal court;

auth_sentence.content: She has no formal computer training, she adds.
auth_sentence.res_content: She has no formal computer training, she adds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She has no formal computer training, she adds.

auth_sentence.content: New Delhi has no formal extradition treaty with Islamabad.
auth_sentence.res_content: New Delhi has no formal extradition treaty with Islamabad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: New Delhi has no formal extradition treaty with Islamabad.

auth_sentence.content: It's a consideration that's not only formal.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's a consideration that's not only formal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's a consideration that's not only formal.

Sentence.sentence: Already, by paying close attention to and interacting with the world and people around him, and without any school-type formal instruction, he has done a task far more difficult, complicated and abstract than anything he will be asked to do in school, or than any of his teachers has done for years.

And now, if you'll walk this way, ladies and gentlemen, the next room we're going to see is the room in which the family used to hold their formal dinner parties and even occasionally entertain heads of state and royalty.
It's difficult to estimate the number of youngsters involved in home schooling where children are not sent to school and receive their formal education from one or both parents

Some parents who withdraw their children from the schools in favor of home schooling have an inadequate educational background and insufficient formal training to provide a satisfactory education for their children.

sentences.en: Sometimes formal English and informal English must be carefully distinguished.
sentences.cn: 有时候正式英语与非正式英语要十分小心地加以区分。

jushi.english: There's only a formal likeness between the two brothers.
They have much formal school training.
jushi.chinese: 他们接受了许多正规的学校教育。

jushi.english: Sometimes formal English and informal English must be carefully distinguished.
jushi.chinese: 有时候正式英语与非正式英语要十分小心地加以区分。
